Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Conway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment if deemed appropriate by the agent and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment if deemed appropriate by the agent and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Mental health assessment if deemed appropriate by the agent.No contact with the victim A.J & T.J. (person, property, residence or family). Contact with the defendant's child to be left up to the mother. Anger management and domestic violence programming. Any assessments, treatment or programming as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Craig A Conway in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Requesting an adjournment and another jury trial. There were other trials that were set to be heard today.

BTC: Adjournment granted. Bond modified to remove ZCI testing, all other conditions to remain. 
  Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with the victim AAJ & TMJ (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 6/28/2016 DEFENDANT NO LONGER HAS TO TEST AT ZCI. All other conditions to remain.**
